column4: Can anyone direct me to a web list of all the available Synaptic packages?
I'm trying to get a friend to switch to Ubuntu, and I'd like to woo her with all the available math and science packages
packages.ubuntu.com
what hardware is that?
check the md5 of your iso image and burnt disc
burn the disc on the slowest burn speed
did you create a / and a "new world bootstrap" or did you just create some free space and let the installer do it?
i'm thinking it's a bad burn of the cd. burn it again on the slowest speed (and dont use Disk Utility)
then join #flood
that is not a wireless problem
you'll need to get something to write with
off the puter, preferably
to solve your hostname problem, reboot the stricken machine and choose 'rescue' at the grub menu
open /etc/hosts for editing and make sure on teh same line as 127.0.0.1 is 'ubuntu' with no quotes
save it and restart the box.
you cannot
it should have 127.0.0.1 in it already
are you sure you're opening /etc/hosts    ?
if it IS empty, put the IP and the name in there (along with 'localhost'  and 'localhost.localdomain')
use the recovery option from the grub prompt
you should be able to run 'pico /etc/hosts'
